full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 49 of 261 1189 LC6VMAX2 Kate - direct statements. A. She sounded really pleased. And I was really pleased that she was pleased. Q. Did you leave Maxwell's house? A. Yes. Q. Other than the three times that you saw Epstein at Maxwell's townhouse in London, did you see anyone else at her house? A. Can you repeat it? Q. Other than the three times you saw Epstein at Maxwell's townhouse in London, did you see anyone else at her house? A. Yes. Q. Who did you see? A. I saw a girl. Q. What did the girl look like? A. She was blond and slim and around my age. Q. Approximately how old were you when you saw the girl? A. Seventeen. Q. And what did you see the girl doing at Maxwell's townhouse? A. She was having tea with Ghislaine and telling -- telling Ghislaine about the things that she was interested in. Q. What, if anything, did Maxwell say to you about what she thought Epstein would think of the girl? A. Can you repeat it please. Q.
